title: Why stupid people think they’re smart.
description:
Also known as The Dunning-Kruger Effect.

channel_info.title: Mark Manson
channel_info.description: 3x #1 NY Times Bestselling Author. World Champion Non-Fuck-Giver.

transcription: Did you know that people who believe they are better drivers than most are actually four times more likely to get into an accident? Or that gun owners who think they are highly knowledgeable score the lowest on tests about gun safety? Or that people who are overweight and obese rate themselves as being healthier than most other people? This is what we call the Dunning-Kruger effect. People who are bad at something tend to believe that they are actually good at it, while people who are good at something tend to believe that they are bad at it. People who are dumb don't know all of the things that they don't know, so they think they're smart. But people who are smart are aware of all of the things they don't know, and therefore think that they're dumb. And this is why the world is a
